wikipedia_page.main: Sir Frederick William Richards Fryer  (1845 – 20 February 1922) served as Lieutenant Governor of the British Crown Colony of Burma from May 1897 to April 1903.Prior to that, he had served as Chief Commissioner of British (Lower) Burma.He was appointed a Companion of the Order of the Star of India (CSI) in 1890, and received a knighthood as Knight Commander of the same order (KCSI) in 1895.
